conclusion: To determine the direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval, we need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph provided.
The graph shows velocity (v) on the y-axis and time (t) on the x-axis.
The graph starts at the origin (0,0), indicating that the skydiver starts from rest.
From 0 to 10 seconds, the velocity increases from 0 m/s to approximately 20 m/s.
The slope of a velocity-time graph represents acceleration.
From 0 to 10 seconds, the graph shows a positive slope, indicating that the velocity is increasing over time.

premise: Since the slope is positive, the acceleration is also positive during this interval.
conclusion: The acceleration is positive during the 0 to 10 seconds interval.
In the context of vertical motion, a positive acceleration means that the skydiver is accelerating downwards because gravity is acting in the downward direction.

premise: The acceleration is positive during the 0 to 10 seconds interval and positive acceleration in vertical motion indicates downward direction.
conclusion: During the 0 to 10 seconds interval, the direction of the acceleration is downward.
